workflow.name: Multi-modal expense tracking with Telegram, Gemini AI & Google Sheets
workflow.description:
## ü§Ø Problem of Traditional Bookkeeping
- üîÄ **Context switch kills the habit**: Because bookkeeping lives outside the apps you use every day, you postpone it ‚Üí **forget to log**.
- üß± **High input friction**: You‚Äôre forced to fill rigid fields (amount/category/date/notes‚Ä¶), which is slow and discouraging for quick capture.
- üéôÔ∏èüí∏ **Weak or pricey natural-language options**: A few tools support voice/chat, but they‚Äôre often **expensive**, and the experience is hit-or-miss.
- üîíüì¶ **Limited data ownership**: Records live on third-party servers, so **privacy and control** are diluted.

## üì≤ How This Workflow Fixes It
- üí¨ **Put the capture back where you already are**: Log expenses directly inside **Telegram** (or other channels) in a **familiar chat**‚Äîno new app to learn.
- ‚ö° **Ultra-low-friction, unstructured input**: Send **text**, a **voice note**, or a **receipt photo**‚Äîthe flow extracts **amount ¬∑ item ¬∑ date**, supports multiple languages and relative dates, and can **split multiple expenses** from one message.
- üóÇÔ∏èüìù **Your data, your sheet**: Final records are written to **your own Google Sheet** (columnar fields or a JSON column). You keep **full control**.

### üîó Demo Google Sheet:¬†[click me](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/18PmxJov2VszEtUlK3IB4Jfbm37hRQbS8D90SSscvoW8/edit?usp=drive_link)


---

## üë• Who Is This For
- üò§ **Anyone fed up with traditional bookkeeping** but curious about an AI-assisted, chat-based way to log expenses.
- ü§ñ **People who tried AI bookkeeping apps** but found them pricey, inflexible, or clunky.
- üíµ **Bookkeeping beginners** who want frictionless capture first, simple review and categorize later.

---

## üß© How It Works
- üí¨ Captures expenses from **Telegram** (text, voice note, or receipt photo).
- üîé Normalizes inputs into **raw text** (uses Gemini to transcribe voice and extract text from images).
- üß† Parses **amount ¬∑ item ¬∑ date** with an LLM expense parser.
- üìä Appends tidy rows to **Google Sheets**.
- üîî Sends a **Telegram confirmation** summarizing exactly what was recorded.

---

## üõ†Ô∏è How to Set Up

### 1) üîë Connect credentials (once)
- TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN
- LLM_API_KEY
- GOOGLE_SHEETS_OAUTH


### 2) üöÄ Quick Start
- **Setup:** Create a Google Sheet to store **Log Expense** data and configure it in n8n.
- **Telegram:** Fill in and verify the **Telegram chatId**.
- ***Remember enable the workflow!***

---

## üß∞ How to Customize the Workflow
- üìù **Other user interaction channels**: Add Gmail, Slack, or a website Webhook to accept email/command/form submissions that map into the same parser.
- üåç **Currency**: Extract and store **`currency`** in its own column (e.g., `MYR`, `USD`); keep **`amount` numeric** only (no symbols).
- üîé **Higher-accuracy OCR / STT to reduce errors**

---

### üì© Help
**Contact:** owenlzyxg@gmail.com

parameters.content:
# üöÄ Quick Start

## üìã Workflow Overview
- **Ingest** Telegram messages as the source (text, voice, image).
- **Route** by type and **validate** supported formats (text/voice/photo only).
- **Transform** voice to text and **extract** text from images via Gemini.
- **Parse** free-form content into structured expense entries (`amount`, `item`, `date`).
- **Write** one entry per row to Google Sheets .
- **Notify** the user on Telegram with a confirmation summary.

## üîÑ How it works
1) **Trigger** on each new Telegram message (event-driven).  
2) **Detect & route**:  
   - Text ‚Üí pass through.  
   - Voice ‚Üí download file ‚Üí transcribe to text via Gemini.  
   - Image ‚Üí download file ‚Üí extract readable text via Gemini.  
3) **Normalize** all paths into a single `raw_text` field for processing.  
4) **Extract** a strict JSON array of `{amount, item, date}` via LLM (date defaults to ‚Äútoday‚Äù when not explicit).  
5) **Auto-fix** malformed JSON and **enforce** the expected schema.  
6) **Split & batch** parsed entries so each entry becomes an individual row.  
7) **Append/Update** rows in Google Sheets.  
8) **Send** a Telegram status message listing `item ‚Äî amount (date)`; **fail fast** with a friendly error for unsupported inputs.

## ‚úÖ Prerequisites
### üîí Credentials
- **Telegram**: Create a bot via BotFather ‚Üí copy the **Bot Token** ‚Üí add the credential in n8n.
- **Google Sheets OAuth2**: Add an OAuth2 credential in n8n and ensure the target spreadsheet is accessible.
- **Gemini (Google AI)**: Add an API credential in n8n for voice transcription, image analysis, and the expense parser nodes.
### üõ†Ô∏è Setup
- **Create Google Sheet**: Create a **Log Expense** Google Sheet.
- **Point the workflow:** Configure the newly created **Google Sheet** in n8n to be used by **GSheet: Log Expense**.
- **Telegram chat ID**: In **Telegram: Send Confirmation**, set `chatId`.
- **Enable the workflow**: Turn on the workflow so it listens for Telegram messages.

## 1) Message Intake & Routing
**Purpose:** Receive user messages and route by input type.  
**Covers nodes:** `Start: On Telegram Message` ‚Üí `Route: Text, Voice or Image?` ‚Üí (`Telegram: Send error message` on unsupported input)  
**What it does:**
- Listens for Telegram messages.
- Detects **text / voice / image** and sends each down the right path.
- Gracefully replies if the message type isn‚Äôt supported.

**Inputs consumed:** Telegram `message` (text/voice/photo).  
**Output produced:** Routed payload for the chosen channel (text, voice, or image).

## 2) Input Capture & Normalization
**Purpose:** Turn everything into plain text for parsing.  
**Covers nodes:**  
`Set: Text Input` 
`Telegram: Get Voice File` ‚Üí `Gemini: Transcribe Voice` ‚Üí `Set: Voice Input (Text)` 
`Telegram: Get Image File` ‚Üí `Gemini: Analyze an image` ‚Üí `Set: image Input (Text)`  
**What it does:**
- Text: uses the message directly.
- Voice: downloads the audio and transcribes it to text.
- Image: downloads the photo and extracts financial text (e.g., amounts, dates, merchant).
- Standardizes to a single **`raw_text`** string regardless of source.

**Inputs consumed:** Telegram text, voice (binary), image (binary).  
**Output produced:** `raw_text` (string).

## 3) Expense Parsing & Validation
**Purpose:** Convert free-form text into structured expenses.  
**Covers nodes:** `AI: Extract Expenses`
**What it does:**
- Parses `raw_text` into a strict JSON array of **{ amount, item, date }**.
- Handles multiple expenses in one message and normalizes dates/amounts.
- Validates/fixes JSON so downstream steps get clean structure.

**Inputs consumed:** `raw_text`.  
**Output produced:** `output` (JSON array of expense objects).

## 4) Row Generation, Sheet Write & Confirmation
**Purpose:** Turn parsed entries into rows, save them, and notify the user.  
**Covers nodes:** `Split: Entries to Rows` ‚Üí `If null?` ‚Üí `Set: Extract Output` ‚Üí `GSheet: Log Expense` ‚Üí `Telegram: Send Confirmation` /**Fallback on empty:** `Telegram: Send Null`
- **What it does:**
- Splits the output array so each expense becomes a single item.  
- (Optional) Map fields to column headers (Amount, Item, Date) in Set: Extract Output.  
- Appends rows in Google Sheets.  
- Sends a brief Telegram summary; if no items, sends a null/empty notice.  

**Inputs consumed:** output (JSON array of expenses)  
**Output produced:** New rows in Google Sheets + a Telegram confirmation (or empty notice)

options.systemMessage:
=You are a STRICT, deterministic expense parser. The user will provide free-form text or an ASR (voice) transcription that describes one or more bookkeeping entries.

GOAL
Return a JSON ARRAY of 0..N objects. Each object has these EXACT keys:
{
  "amount": number | null,        // numeric value only; no currency symbol
  "item": string | null,          // what was paid for / received
  "date": date                 // ISO 8601 "YYYY-MM-DD"; 

CURRENT DATE CONTEXT (REQUIRED)
- NOW_ISO = "{{ new Date }}" 
- Define CURRENT_DATE as the calendar date of NOW_ISO (YYYY-MM-DD) respecting its timezone info if present.

HARD RULES (NO HALLUCINATIONS)
- Work ONLY with the given input text; DO NOT invent, infer, or fetch anything external.
- If a field cannot be reliably determined, set it to null (do NOT guess). Exception: "date" must never be null‚Äîif no explicit/relative date is found, use CURRENT_DATE.
- Output MUST be raw JSON array only (no markdown, no comments, no extra text).
- Each distinct purchase must yield its own object. Do NOT merge separate purchases. Do NOT compute totals from line items unless the text explicitly marks a ‚Äútotal‚Äù.
- Amounts are positive numbers; do NOT add signs to indicate expense/income.

MULTI-ENTRY DETECTION
Treat as separate purchases when the text clearly presents distinct (amount, item) pairs or clearly separated entries by:
- Newlines, bullet points, semicolons/commas that separate complete (amount + item) phrases, or connectors like ‚Äúand/&, plus‚Äù when each part has its own amount or distinct item.
- Examples of separate entries:
  - "Lunch 12; Grab 18; Netflix 55" ‚Üí three objects.
  - "RM8 coffee, RM5 bun" ‚Üí two objects.
NOT separate (single entry):
  - A list of items but ONE explicit "total" (e.g., "apples 3, milk 5, total 8") ‚Üí output ONE object with amount=8 and item=apples & milk.
  - Quantity/price math for the same item (e.g., "2 x coffee RM5 each, total RM10") ‚Üí ONE object, amount=10, item="coffee".
If multiple amounts exist but items are not clearly distinguishable, create multiple objects with item=null rather than guessing item names.

AMOUNT PARSING
- Normalize to a JSON number (strip currency symbols/codes/words): RM12.50 ‚Üí 12.5, $1,299 ‚Üí 1299, MYR 36 ‚Üí 36.
- Support magnitude suffixes: 1.2k/1.2K ‚Üí 1200; 36k/36K ‚Üí 36000.
- Prefer an explicit total; if both unit price and total appear for the same purchase, choose the total.
- Ignore percentages unless explicitly stated as the paid amount.
- If multiple numeric candidates exist within one purchase with no clear total, choose the first well-formed currency-like amount; otherwise amount = null.

ITEM EXTRACTION
- Concise description of what the payment is for (e.g., "coffee", "Grab ride", "rental", "Netflix subscription").
- Remove ASR fillers (‚Äúuh‚Äù, ‚Äúyou know‚Äù), keep core item only.
- If truly unknown, item = null.

DATE RESOLUTION
- Always output ISO "YYYY-MM-DD".
- Recognize explicit dates in common formats and normalize (e.g., 22/10/2025, 2025-10-22, Oct 22, 2025). If month/day are given without a year and it is unambiguous, fill the year from CURRENT_DATE; otherwise treat missing parts as absent and use CURRENT_DATE.
- Relative terms (multi-language; case-insensitive):
  - "today", "‰ªäÂ§©", "hari ini" ‚Üí CURRENT_DATE
  - "yesterday", "Êò®Â§©", "semalam" ‚Üí CURRENT_DATE minus 1 day
  - "tomorrow", "ÊòéÂ§©", "esok" ‚Üí CURRENT_DATE plus 1 day
  - "the day before yesterday" / "ÂâçÂ§©" ‚Üí CURRENT_DATE minus 2 days
- If a single relative date clearly applies to the whole input, apply it to all entries. If different parts contain different explicit/relative dates, resolve per entry. If no date cue for an entry, use CURRENT_DATE.

NORMALIZATION & SANITY
- Trim whitespace; tolerate ASR noise and mixed punctuation (including full-width).
- Do not include currency symbols/codes anywhere in JSON.

OUTPUT FORMAT
- Return exactly one JSON array. Each array element is an object with keys in this order: amount, item, date.
- Numbers must be valid JSON numbers (no quotes).

EXAMPLES (assume NOW_ISO = "2025-10-22T15:00:00+08:00", so CURRENT_DATE = "2025-10-22")

Input: "Paid RM12.50 for latte at Starbucks today"
Output:
[{"amount":12.5,"item":"latte at Starbucks","date":"2025-10-22"}]

Input: "Grab ride to Mid Valley, 18 ringgit, yesterday; Netflix monthly 55"
Output:
[
  {"amount":18,"item":"Grab ride to Mid Valley","date":"2025-10-21"},
  {"amount":55,"item":"Netflix monthly","date":"2025-10-22"}
]

Input: "RM8 coffee, RM5 bun"
Output:
[
  {"amount":8,"item":"coffee","date":"2025-10-22"},
  {"amount":5,"item":"bun","date":"2025-10-22"}
]

Input: "apples 3, milk 5, TOTAL 8"
Output:
[{"amount":8,"item":"apples & milk","date":"2025-10-22"}]

parameters.text: =ü§ñSorry, I can only understand text, voice and image for bookkeeping.

=Financial Image Text Extraction Prompt

Your task is to analyze the provided image and **extract all text and numerical information related to financial or transactional data**.  
The image may contain receipts, invoices, transfer records, expense summaries, or digital payment screenshots (e.g., WeChat, Alipay, banking apps).

#### Instructions:
- Extract **all visible text and numbers**, including:
  - Dates and times  
  - Merchant or transaction party names  
  - Notes, descriptions, or remarks  
  - Amounts, currency symbols, and positive/negative signs  
  - Summary information (e.g., total income, total expense)
- **Preserve the original order and wording** as they appear in the image.  
- Ensure numerical accuracy and retain all currency symbols.  
- **Ignore decorative or non-informational elements**, such as logos, icons, watermarks, background graphics, or design borders.  
- Do **not** interpret, categorize, or restructure the extracted data.  
  The output should be **raw readable text** that captures all relevant words and numbers for bookkeeping analysis.

#### Goal:
Produce an **accurate, unmodified textual extraction** of the financial and accounting information visible in the image ‚Äî ready for further processing by a bookkeeping or accounting system.

{error}

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
